column4: Anyone know where I can find a xorg file that isn't modified.
In the backup you should have made before changing the original.
Yea exactly I was given someone elses xorg to configure my graphics driver, because my resolution was messed up.
So I have a feeling it's why I can't boot from CD
If you need to recreate it, however, just run dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
Reformer8: Will that fix it?
just type that in terminal?
It's possible.
Thanks, I'll try
Reformer8: Not much happened there it was just some "keyboard" config
If you go through the whole thing, it should also configure your mouse and video driver
I did
Reformer8: This is what happened afterwards, xserver-xorg postinst warning: overwriting possibly-customised configuration
file; backup in /etc/X11/xorg.conf.20080714174235
Right... go through it.
You may need to do it with sudo.
I did
Man I give up
Well, next time, always make a backup of any configuration files you change.
Not only should it be common sense, it should also be a part of ANY tutorial you follow online.
